title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 18, 2019).

Neither Netanyahu nor main rival Gantz commanded a majority after Israelis voted, exit polls suggested, potentially opening a period of uncertainty over the next government.

The Trump administration plans Wednesday to revoke California's federal waiver for setting its own tailpipe-emissions rules.

U.S. and Saudi military forces and their air-defense systems failed to detect the launch of airstrikes aimed at Saudi Arabian oil facilities, U.S. officials said.

Biden and Warren are beginning to separate themselves from the rest of the Democratic presidential field, a new poll found.

Senators criticized how the Justice Department and FTC are orchestrating major antitrust reviews of the biggest tech companies.

The Treasury released proposed regulations on expanding the scope of national security reviews of foreign investment deals.

Ex-campaign manager Lewandowski stonewalled lawmakers on the House Judiciary panel about his conversations with Trump.

Brazilian police are set to announce criminal charges against employees of Vale and a German safety inspector in a deadly dam collapse.

Died: Cokie Roberts, 75, pioneering journalist.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 18, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
